author: schone_wizard
content: i dont want to speak for <@!755590043632140352> but i think generally it would seem more fair to everybody if whistleblowers could be exactly that and receive the reward for such work.... at the moment many 'validators'/rigs could be doing the work, but it just has to be the proposer who happens to luck out when such proof is available to rip the rewards from it

author: schone_wizard
content: also at the moment such work, really does entail resources from you.  so sure altruistic there are plenty, but the incentive slowly dwindles away as the beacon chain size and RAM requirements grow for running a slasher

author: schone_wizard
content: (putting aside the fact Prysm will soon be offering a built-in one inside their beacon chain)

author: pietjepuk
content: I don't disagree that it'd be nice to have the financial incentives aligned (I asked this very question a few months back), but I was trying to make the point that it is rather low on the priority list for good reason. Again, only _one_ altruistic slasher is needed. Compare that to the low incentives of running an ethx client when staking, and perverse incentives with MEV/VEV that have a centralizing effect.

author: potuz
content: I didn't mean to start an argument on whether this is needed nor the merits of having this. I'm aware of the complications. I literally meant to ask if there are plans. My interest comes from a vague intuition that the consensus layer will slowly start growing in messages it should handle. And depending on this it may be beneficial to plan ahead 1) a merge of the p2p stacks of both consensus and execution layers and 2) some gas-like mechanism for the consensus messages.
